bibl.title: Hazzard v. Aguirre and Price. Filed
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Pierce} ss.
To the Honorable Frank Allyn Judge of the Second Judicial District of the Territory of Washington.
Your petitioner, George Hazard, a citizen of the Territory of Washington, respectfully represents into your Honor as follows:
First: That he is unlawfully restrained of his liberty by me M.H. Aguirre and one James H. Price, at the County jail of the County of Pierce in the City of Tacoma in said County of Pierce--

Second: That the cause on pretense under and by which the said M.H. Aguirre and the said James H. Price, so unlawfully restrain your petitioner of his liberty at the place aforesaid, so, according to your petitioner's best knowledge and belief, a certain pretended warrant issued by the Governor of Territory of Washington, upon the alleged demand of the Executive of the State of California, authorizing the said M.H. Aguirre to arrest and convey your petitioner to the line of the territory, and requiring all civil officers in this territory to afford all needful assistance in the Execution of such warrant
Third. That the restraint of your petitioner by the said M.H. Aguirre and the said James
